intro: Oreodaphne umbrosa, commonly known as the dark-leaved daphne, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves that are often glossy in appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, followed by elliptical, woody fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
